divs: sighting detailsback in 1983-1984 (i think i was about 13-14 years old) i was at my local aussie rules football (frankston ycw) club in frankston at a "sausage sizzle" with my team mates. a "sausage sizzle" is an event for the team to get together with parents and cook sausages etc and have some fun at the club house. i guess at about 8pm, after we ate, the parents moved inside the club house to talk and have fun etc while us kids basically ran around the football grounds getting up to mischief like nick-knocking and playing tag in the dark etc. we had a great sporting area called jubilee park with two huge ovals (and a smaller one) surrounded by creeks and scrub\bush and a railway line which is surrounded by housing. there were also netball courts and a swimming centre. we often used to get the railway crossing lights working using a coat-hanger and would have traffic stopped for ages. at the time a huge laugh!! this particular night was just like every other sausage sizzle. young kids running around like crazy. at some point during the evening myself and another team mate (don't want to name him) ended up taking a break by lying on our backs on the north side of the smaller oval on a very small embankment star gazing to the north. we were talking and laughing etc and just watching the stars. i was looking at different stars and for no reason in-particular focused on what i thought was a nice bright star imaging how far away it was and which part of the universe it belonged to. i estimate i was staring at this 'star' for about 30 secs when it dropped from the sky as if someone had cut a string holding it in place. it fell for about 1 second (not fast) and then moved in a reverse 'j' motion and shot away into space at an incredible speed. it definitely accelerated and didn't just vanish. being young i freaked out and said to my friend "did you see that?" he said "what?" at that i got up and bolted inside the club house and sat with the parents for the rest of the night which you can imagine was pretty rare as everyone else was outside playing. the exact co-ordinates on google earth where we were, are: 38 degrees 09'04.36 s - 145 degrees 09'34.72 e i've never documented this story but have told a few people, all who either don't believe it or seem intrigued. after reading back over the above it doesn't seem to be very believable but i know what i saw. it was real. the funny thing is i probably wouldn't be typing this but i just read someone else saying almost the exact same thing with regard to their experience...in the usa i think. i must say that did give me goose bumps when i read his\her account.
trends: There have been 40 other sightings in Melbourne
There were no other sightings in Melbourne on or around June 20th 1984
Summary: Watching motionless star-like light then just dropped like someone cut a string and shot into space
